skills: Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat Professional, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, QuarkXPress, Adobe Dreamweaver, HTML, WordPress, graphic design, administrative functions, team player, customer service, project management, listening to directions, note-taking, design setup for printing, backup, advertising, basic, business cards, conversion, direct mail, email, fax, graphics, Mac, Macintosh computers, Marketing Communications, mail, office, monitors, network, newsletters, PDF, copiers, posters, printer, printers, proofing, quality, supply inventory, phone, UNIX, web development, web pages
summary: Creative, hardworking designer seeking a full-time desktop job, educated as a graphic artist, past experience in business world as a desktop publisher laying out designs for printed mail and advertisements, in local government designing new websites with graphics for different agencies within the system, and later for the same government printing and reproduction center creating documents to be printed off a press or copiers.
work_experience: The candidate has extensive experience in graphic design and pre-press roles, starting as a Graphic Designer in 1997, performing temporary office jobs using Macintosh computers for design and printing for various companies. From 1998 to 2000, as a Desktop Publisher, they converted documents, used QuarkXPress for job setup, and trained staff. As a Web Designer from 2000 to 2008, they created and updated websites, designed web graphics, converted digital files, and handled site change requests. Since 2008, as a Pre-Press Graphic Designer, key responsibilities include creating new designs for various items, using templates, proofing jobs, manufacturing high-quality PDFs for printing, file backup, inventory management, operating photocopying and bindery equipment, laminating, and ensuring timely submission of files to production.
